concept-wr.title: Ethernet Interfaces
concept-wr.shortdesc: Ethernet interfaces, both physical and virtual, play a key role in the overall performance of the virtualized network. Therefore, it is important to understand the available interface types, their configuration options, and their impact on network design.

section.title: About LAG/AE Interfaces
section.p: CGTS-4597 added: up to 4 in a LAG groupYou can use link aggregation (LAG) for Ethernet interfaces. Titanium Server supports up to four ports in a LAG group.

Ethernet interfaces in a LAG group can be attached either to the same L2 switch, or to multiple switches in a redundant configuration. For more information about L2 switch configurations, see . For information about the different LAG modes, see Titanium Server System Administration:.
